title: Angular.js ng-repeat notation
body:
You should iterate over the array of xwings and then iterate over their dials and then use a nested ng-repeat to solve the iterating of rows and cols

PLUNKER

Something like this

$scope.xWingArr = [
    {

         "name": "X-Wing",
         "factions": "rebels",
         "attack": 3,
         "agility": 2,

         "dial": [   // This is the data I want
             [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0],
             [0, 2, 2, 2, 0, 0],
             [1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 0],
             [1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0],
             [0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 3]
        ]
    }, // n...
]

<div ng-repeat="xWing in xWingArr">
  <div class="dials">
    <div class="row-dial" ng-repeat="row in xWing.dial">
      <br/>
      <div class="col-dial" ng-repeat="col in row track by $index">

        <span ng-class="{ 'white': dial[$parent.$index][$index] === 1,'green': dial[$parent.$index][$index] === 2, 'red':dial[$parent.$index][$index] === 3}"></span> 
        <i ng-if="dial[$parent.$index][$index] === 0"></i>
        <i class="xwing-miniatures-font xwing-miniatures-font-turnleft" ng-if="dial[$parent.$index][$index] > 0"></i>

      </div>

    </div>

  </div>
</div>
